summary:
I got tired of not being able to summon Durnehviir 99,99% of times and decided to make this little mod.

This mod adds a spell that allows you to summon Durnehviir. The summoned dragon is the same you summon with the shout, i.e. he will teach you the Soul Tear shout and fight for you as if you had used the vanilla shout.
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=yellow]
[size=3]---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You can not use my assets in any mods/files that are being sold, for money, on Steam Workshop or other platforms
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size]
[/color][/center]

Name: Ashara's Conjure Durnehviir
Version: 1.0
Date: 26-04-2013
Category: Magic - Spells and enchantments
Requirements: Dawnguard and Latest Skyrim official patch (1.9.32)
Author(s): Ashara
Source:
* On Nexus: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/35244
* On Steam: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=141234080


[center][size=14][color=yellow]Description
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
I got tired of not being able to summon Durnehviir 99,99% of times and decided to make this little mod.
Although I've tried all the solutions I've found on the internet (shout at my feet; shout in front of me at 10 or 15 or 20 feet; shout to the ground in a big flat place without trees; shout to a wall; shout another shout and then go back to the one summoning Durnehviir; shout during combat; shout when moving a little, or when moving a lot; wait for 2, 3, 24 hours and then shout again; go to a different place and shout again; etc) I've been only able of making the shout work twice, and that by chance. The rest of the times I only shout two words and the dragon doesn't appear.
The advantage of conjuration spells is that the cursor turns red when you cannot cast the spell, but that doesnt happen with this shout, so I thought it would be easier to summon Durnehviir with a conjuration spell.

This mod adds a spell that allows you to summon Durnehviir. The summoned dragon is the same you summon with the shout, i.e. he will teach you the Soul Tear shout and fight for you as if you had used the vanilla shout.

To add this spell to your character you need to use the console:
* open the in game console and type
* help "Ashara Conjure Durnehviir"
* note down the spell code (it will be XX002F9A where XX is the load order of this mod) and type
* player.addspell XX002F9A (instead of the XX use your load order number)

To remove the spell from your character type:
* player.removespell XX002F9A (instead of the XX use your load order number)

This mod doesn't add any script. It uses Dawnguard existing scripts.


[color=red]IMPORTANT:
Don't use this spell if you haven't defeated Durnehviir in Soul Cairn yet. It may break Dawnguard's main quest (and even if it doesn't you may be smarter than me and be able to use the shout without problems ;))[/color]


[size=14][color=yellow]Required mods
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
* Dawnguard DLC


[size=14][color=yellow]Install
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
Install using Nexus Mod Manager (NMM)
-------------------------------------
1. Download the file
2. Select the file in the Mods tab of NMM, and click on the "Activates the selected mod" button.

If asked if you want to overwrite existing files say "Yes to all".


Manual install
--------------
1. Extract the files of this mod to a temporary location (you can use 7zip: http://www.7-zip.org, to unzip them) and chek the folder structure.
2. Copy to (install folder)SkyrimData:
.- the AsharaConjureDurnehviir.esp

3. Open the Skyrim launcher and in "Data files" check the AsharaConjureDurnehviir.esp. Make sure that the esp is loaded after Skyrim.esm, Update.esm and Dawnguard.esm and that all four files are active.

If asked if you want to overwrite existing files say "Yes to all".


[size=14][color=yellow]Uninstall
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
First of all remove the spell from your character
* open the ingame console and type
* player.removespell XX002F9A (instead of the XX use your load order number)
* save the game

Uninstall using Nexus Mod Manager (NMM)
-------------------------------------
1. Select the file in the Mods tab of NMM, and click on the "Deactivates the selected mod" button.

Manual uninstall
----------------
1. Delete:
.- the AsharaConjureDurnehviir.esp


[size=14][color=yellow]Incompatibility
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
None that I am aware of. If you find anything, please tell me.


[size=14][color=yellow]Known Issues or Bugs
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
None that I am aware of. If you find anything, please tell me.

[size=14][color=yellow]Tutorials
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
* [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php?title=User:SydneyB]Other Tutorials[/url]

[size=14][color=yellow]History
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
1.0, 26-04-2013 - Initial release.


[size=14][color=yellow]Contact
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
You can contact me leaving a comment at the mod's thread, sending me a PM or leaving a comment at the mod's thread.

You can find me on Nexus as SydneyB: http://www.tesnexus.com/modules/members/index.php?id=259193.
You can find me on the Bethesda official forums as Ashara: http://www.bethsoft.com/bgsforums/index.php?showuser=364891.
You can find me on Clan Dlan as Ashara: http://www.clandlan.net/foros/index.php?showuser=6932.


[size=14][color=yellow]Credits
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
Thanks to Bethesda for creating Skyrim.
Thanks to LHammonds for the Readme Generator this file was based on: [url=http://hammondslegacy.com/obmm/tools_readme_generator1.asp]http://hammondslegacy.com/obmm/tools_readme_generator1.asp[/url]
Thanks to Nexus for the a one-stop-shop resource for authors and players.
Thanks to all the modding community for all their tutorials, tools and help. Especially, thanks to the Clan Dlan, Tes Adventures, Bethesda Official Forum and the Nexus communities.
Thanks to all of you that are using this mod and are helping me to improve it with your suggestions.


[size=14][color=yellow]Tools Used
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
Construction Kit (available on Steam)
7zip - http://www.7-zip.org/
Readme Generator - http://lhammonds.game-host.org/obmm/tools_readme_generator1.asp


[size=14][color=yellow]Permissions
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
You can reuse my work in this mod into your own mod but all I ask in return is that you give me credit if you distribute any part of this mod.


[size=14][color=yellow]My Skyrim mods
==========================================================================================================================================[/size][/color]
